# look(at:)

**Instance Method**

Changes the node’s orientation so that its local forward vector points toward the specified location.

## Declaration

```swift
func look(at worldTarget: SCNVector3)
```

## Parameters

- **worldTarget**: The point, in world space, to face the node toward.

## Discussion

Using this method is equivalent to calling the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/look(at:up:localFront:)] method and passing the node’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/worldUp] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/localFront] vectors for the corresponding parameters.

The effects of this method are animatable; that is, calling this method during an implicit-animation transaction animates the rotation effect. (See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].)

## Related Documentation

- **simdLook(at:)**: Changes the node’s orientation so that its local forward vector points toward the specified location.

## Performing Node-Relative Operations (SceneKit Types)

- **rotate(by:aroundTarget:)**: Changes the node’s position and orientation, relative to its current transform, through a rotation around the specified point in scene space.
- **localTranslate(by:)**: Changes the node’s position relative to its current position.
- **localRotate(by:)**: Changes the node’s orientation relative to its current orientation.
- **look(at:up:localFront:)**: Changes the node’s orientation so that the specified forward vector points toward the specified location.
